titles.title: Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2007
A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to deliver a meaningful benefit and lower prescription drug prices under the Medicare Program.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S13263-13264)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:
10/23/2007--Introduced.
Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2007 - Amends part D (Voluntary Prescription Drug Benefit Program) of title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to provide for: (1) establishment of one or more Medicare operated prescription drug plan options; (2) an appeals process for denials of benefits under a Medicare operated prescription drug plan; and (3) pharmacy payments under such a plan.
